alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 12:43PM EDT until August 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT/345 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Casey. In south central Kentucky, Adair and Russell. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT /345 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1143 AM CDT /1243 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jamestown, Russell Springs, Sano, Royville, Webbs Cross Roads, Jericho, Sycamore Flat, Gentrys Mill, Ella and Fonthill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
